tags.name: media-icon
tags.description:
The `<media-icon>` component dynamically loads and renders our custom Vidstack icons. See our
[media icons catalog](https://www.vidstack.io/media-icons) to preview them all. Do note, the icon `type` can
be dynamically changed.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
The type of icon. You can find a complete and searchable list on our website - see our
[media icons catalog](https://vidstack.io/media-icons).

tags.name: media-outlet
tags.description: Used to render the current provider.

tags.name: media-player
tags.description:
All media elements exist inside the `<media-player>` component. This component's main
responsibilities are to manage media state updates, dispatch media events, handle media
requests, and expose media state through HTML attributes and CSS properties for styling
purposes.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: The URL and optionally type of the current media resource/s to be considered for playback.

attributes.name: log-level
attributes.description:
The current log level. Values in order of priority are: `silent`, `error`, `warn`, `info`,
and `debug`.

attributes.name: load
attributes.description:
Indicates when the provider can begin loading media.

- `eager`: media will be loaded immediately.
- `idle`: media will be loaded after the page has loaded and `requestIdleCallback` is fired.
- `visible`: media will delay loading until the provider has entered the viewport.
- `custom`: media will wait for the `startLoading()` method or `media-start-loading` event.

attributes.name: user-idle-delay
attributes.description:
The amount of delay in milliseconds while media playback is progressing without user
activity to indicate an idle state.

attributes.name: fullscreen-orientation
attributes.description:
This method will indicate the orientation to lock the screen to when in fullscreen mode and
the Screen Orientation API is available. The default is `undefined` which indicates
no screen orientation change.

attributes.name: prefer-native-hls
attributes.description:
Whether native HLS support is preferred over using `hls.js`. We recommend setting this to
`false` to ensure a consistent and configurable experience across browsers. In addition, our
live stream support and DVR detection is much better with `hls.js` so choose accordingly.

This should generally only be set to `true` if (1) you're working with HLS streams, and (2)
you want AirPlay to work via the native Safari controls (i.e., `controls` attribute is
present on the `<media-player>` element).

attributes.name: aspect-ratio
attributes.description: The aspect ratio of the player media given as 'width/height' (e.g., 16/9).

attributes.name: key-disabled
attributes.description:
Whether keyboard support is disabled for the media player globally. This property won't disable
standard ARIA keyboard controls for individual components when focused.

attributes.name: key-target
attributes.description:
The target on which to listen for keyboard events (e.g., `keydown`):

- `document`: the player will listen for events on the entire document. In the case that
multiple players are on the page, only the most recently active player will receive input.
- `player`: the player will listen for events on the player itself or one of its children
were recently interacted with.

attributes.name: key-shortcuts
attributes.description:
Extends global media player keyboard shortcuts. The shortcuts can be specified as a
space-separated list of combinations (e.g., `p Control+Space`), see the provided doc link
for more information.

Do note, if `aria-keyshortcuts` is specified on a component then it will take precedence
over the respective value set here.

attributes.name: small-breakpoint-x
attributes.description: The maximum player width in pixels for when the small breakpoint should be active.

attributes.name: large-breakpoint-x
attributes.description: The minimum player width in pixels for when the large breakpoint should begin being active.

attributes.name: small-breakpoint-y
attributes.description: The maximum player height in pixels for when the small breakpoint should be active.

attributes.name: large-breakpoint-y
attributes.description: The minimum player height in pixels for when the large breakpoint should begin being active.

attributes.name: autoplay
attributes.description:
Whether playback should automatically begin as soon as enough media is available to do so
without interruption.

Sites which automatically play audio (or videos with an audio track) can be an unpleasant
experience for users, so it should be avoided when possible. If you must offer autoplay
functionality, you should make it opt-in (requiring a user to specifically enable it).

However, autoplay can be useful when creating media elements whose source will be set at a
later time, under user control.

attributes.name: controls
attributes.description:
Indicates whether a user interface should be shown for controlling the resource. Set this to
`false` when you want to provide your own custom controls, and `true` if you want the current
provider to supply its own default controls. Depending on the provider, changing this prop
may cause the player to completely reset.

attributes.name: crossorigin
attributes.description:
Defines how the media element handles cross-origin requests, thereby enabling the
configuration of the CORS requests for the element's fetched data.

attributes.name: current-time
attributes.description:
A `double` indicating the current playback time in seconds. Defaults to `0` if the media has
not started to play and has not seeked. Setting this value seeks the media to the new
time. The value can be set to a minimum of `0` and maximum of the total length of the
media (indicated by the duration prop).

attributes.name: loop
attributes.description:
Whether media should automatically start playing from the beginning (replay) every time
it ends.

attributes.name: muted
attributes.description: Whether the audio is muted or not.

attributes.name: paused
attributes.description:
Whether playback should be paused. Defaults to `true` if no media has loaded or playback has
not started. Setting this to `false` will begin/resume playback.

attributes.name: playsinline
attributes.description:
Whether the video is to be played "inline", that is within the element's playback area. Note
that setting this to `false` does not imply that the video will always be played in fullscreen.
Depending on the provider, changing this prop may cause the player to completely reset.

attributes.name: poster
attributes.description:
The URL of the current poster. Defaults to `''` if no media/poster has been given or
loaded.

attributes.name: preload
attributes.description:
Configures the preload setting of the underlying media provider once it can load (see
`loading` property).

The `preload` attribute provides a hint to the browser about what the author thinks will
lead to the best user experience with regards to what content is loaded before the video is
played. The recommended default is `metadata`.

attributes.name: playback-rate
attributes.description:
Sets the rate at which the media is being played back. This is used to implement user
controls for fast forward, slow motion, and so forth. The normal playback rate is multiplied
by this value to obtain the current rate, so a value of 1.0 indicates normal speed.

Examples:

- `0.5` = slow down to 50% of the normal speed
- `1.5` = speed up normal speed by 50%
- `2` = double the normal speed

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: The title of the current media.

attributes.name: thumbnails
attributes.description:
The absolute or relative URL to a [WebVTT](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebVTT_API)
file resource.

attributes.name: view-type
attributes.description:
The type of player view that should be used (i.e., audio or video). By default this is set
to `video`.

attributes.name: volume
attributes.description: An `int` between `0` (silent) and `1` (loudest) indicating the audio volume. Defaults to `1`.

attributes.name: stream-type
attributes.description:
The current media stream type. This value helps determine what type of UI should be
displayed and whether seeking operations are permitted during live streams. If seeking
is permitted, set this value to `live:dvr` or `ll-live:dvr`.

attributes.name: live-edge-tolerance
attributes.description:
The number of seconds that `currentTime` can be behind `liveEdgeStart` and still be considered
at the edge. The default value is 10, meaning the user can be up to 10 seconds behind the
live edge start and still be considered live.

attributes.name: min-live-dvrwindow
attributes.description: The minimum seekable length in seconds before seeking operations are permitted.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: Translation map from english to your desired language for words used throughout the skin.

tags.name: media-buffering-indicator
tags.description:
Display a loading indicator to users before the media is ready for playback or when
waiting for media to buffer.

tags.name: media-caption-button
tags.description: A button for toggling the showing state of the captions.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the button should be disabled (non-interactive).

attributes.name: default-appearance
attributes.description:
Whether the default button appearance should stay visible when elements have been passed inside
it.

attributes.name: default-pressed
attributes.description:
Whether it should start in the on (pressed) state. This prop is only available on the base
`<media-toggle-button>`.

tags.name: media-fullscreen-button
tags.description: A button for toggling the fullscreen mode of the player.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
The target element on which to request fullscreen on. The target can be `media`
(i.e., `<media-player>`) or `provider`. The `prefer-media` option will first see if the native
fullscreen API is available, if not it'll try the media provider.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the button should be disabled (non-interactive).

attributes.name: default-appearance
attributes.description:
Whether the default button appearance should stay visible when elements have been passed inside
it.

attributes.name: default-pressed
attributes.description:
Whether it should start in the on (pressed) state. This prop is only available on the base
`<media-toggle-button>`.

tags.name: media-mute-button
tags.description: A button for toggling the muted state of the player.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the button should be disabled (non-interactive).

attributes.name: default-appearance
attributes.description:
Whether the default button appearance should stay visible when elements have been passed inside
it.

attributes.name: default-pressed
attributes.description:
Whether it should start in the on (pressed) state. This prop is only available on the base
`<media-toggle-button>`.

tags.name: media-pip-button
tags.description: A button for toggling the picture-in-picture (PIP) mode of the player.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the button should be disabled (non-interactive).

attributes.name: default-appearance
attributes.description:
Whether the default button appearance should stay visible when elements have been passed inside
it.

attributes.name: default-pressed
attributes.description:
Whether it should start in the on (pressed) state. This prop is only available on the base
`<media-toggle-button>`.

tags.name: media-play-button
tags.description: A button for toggling the playback state (play/pause) of the current media.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the button should be disabled (non-interactive).

attributes.name: default-appearance
attributes.description:
Whether the default button appearance should stay visible when elements have been passed inside
it.

attributes.name: default-pressed
attributes.description:
Whether it should start in the on (pressed) state. This prop is only available on the base
`<media-toggle-button>`.

tags.name: media-seek-button
tags.description: A button for seeking the current media playback forwards or backwards by a specified amount.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the button should be disabled (non-interactive).

attributes.name: default-appearance
attributes.description:
Whether the default button appearance should stay visible when elements have been passed inside
it.

attributes.name: seconds
attributes.description:
The amount to seek the media playback forwards (positive number) or backwards (negative number)
when the seek button is pressed.

tags.name: media-toggle-button
tags.description: A toggle button is a two-state button that can be either off (not pressed) or on (pressed).

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the button should be disabled (non-interactive).

attributes.name: default-appearance
attributes.description:
Whether the default button appearance should stay visible when elements have been passed inside
it.

attributes.name: default-pressed
attributes.description:
Whether it should start in the on (pressed) state. This prop is only available on the base
`<media-toggle-button>`.

tags.name: media-captions
tags.description:
Renders and displays captions/subtitles. This will be an overlay for video and a simple
captions box for audio.

tags.name: media-gesture
tags.description: This component enables actions to be performed on the media based on user gestures.

attributes.name: event
attributes.description:
The DOM event type that will trigger this gesture. It can be any valid DOM event type. Any
event can be prefixed with `dbl` to ensure it occurs twice in succession (max 200ms gap).

attributes.name: action
attributes.description:
An action describes the type of media request event that will be dispatched, which will
ultimately perform some operation on the player.

tags.name: media-live-indicator
tags.description:
This component displays the current live status of the stream. This includes whether it's
live, at the live edge, or not live. In addition, this component is a button during live streams
and will skip ahead to the live edge when pressed.

🚨 This component will contain no content, sizing, or role when the current stream is _not_ live.

tags.name: media-audio-menu-button
tags.description:
This component is a pre-styled menu button that controls the opening and closing of a audio
tracks menu.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the button should be disabled (non-interactive).

tags.name: media-audio-menu-items
tags.description:
This component displays menu radio options to the user so they can manually change the current
audio track.

attributes.name: empty-label
attributes.description: The text to display when the are no audio tracks.

tags.name: media-captions-menu-button
tags.description:
This component is a pre-styled menu button that controls the opening and closing of a captions
menu.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the button should be disabled (non-interactive).

tags.name: media-captions-menu-items
tags.description:
This component displays menu radio options to the user so they can manually change the current
captions/subtitles track.

attributes.name: off-label
attributes.description: The text to display when the captions are turned off.

tags.name: media-chapters-menu-items
tags.description: This component displays media chapters inside of a menu.

tags.name: media-menu-button
tags.description:
A button that controls the opening and closing of a menu component. The button will become a
menuitem when used inside a submenu.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the button should be disabled (non-interactive).

tags.name: media-menu-items
tags.description: Menu items can be used to display settings or arbitrary content in a floating panel.

tags.name: media-menu
tags.description: This component is used to display options in a floating panel.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: Specifies the position at which the main menu items are opened.

tags.name: media-playback-rate-menu-button
tags.description:
This component is a pre-styled menu button that controls the opening and closing of a playback
rate menu.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the button should be disabled (non-interactive).

tags.name: media-playback-rate-menu-items
tags.description:
This component displays menu radio options to the user so they can manually change the current
playback speed.

attributes.name: rates
attributes.description: The playback rate options to be displayed.

attributes.name: normal-label
attributes.description: The text to display for normal speed (i.e., playback rate of 1).

tags.name: media-quality-menu-button
tags.description:
This component is a pre-filled menu button that controls the opening and closing of a quality
rate menu.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the button should be disabled (non-interactive).

tags.name: media-quality-menu-items
tags.description:
This component displays menu radio options to the user so they can manually change the current
playback quality.

attributes.name: auto-label
attributes.description: The text to display for the auto quality radio option.

attributes.name: hide-bitrate
attributes.description: Whether the bitrate should _not_ be displayed next to each quality radio option.

tags.name: media-radio-group
tags.description:
A radio group consists of options where only one of them can be checked. Each option is
provided as a radio (i.e., a selectable element).

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The radio value that is checked in this group.

tags.name: media-radio
tags.description:
A radio represents a option that a user can select inside of a radio group. Only one radio
can be checked in a group.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The radio value.

tags.name: media-poster
tags.description:
Loads and displays the current media poster image. By default, the media provider's
loading strategy is respected meaning the poster won't load until the media can.

attributes.name: alt
attributes.description:
♿ **ARIA:** Provides alternative information for a poster image if a user for some reason
cannot view it.

tags.name: media-slider-thumbnail
tags.description:
Used to display preview thumbnails when the user is hovering or dragging the time slider.
The time ranges in the WebVTT file will automatically be matched based on the current slider
pointer position.

tags.name: media-slider-value
tags.description: Outputs the current slider value as text.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Whether to use the slider's current value, or pointer value.

attributes.name: format
attributes.description: Determines how the value is formatted.

attributes.name: show-hours
attributes.description:
Whether the time should always show the hours unit, even if the time is less than
1 hour. Only available if the `format` attribute is set to `time`.

attributes.name: pad-hours
attributes.description:
Whether the hours unit should be padded with zeroes to a length of 2. Only available if
the `format` attribute is set to `time`.

attributes.name: pad-minutes
attributes.description:
Whether the minutes unit should be padded with zeroes to a length of 2. Only available if
the `format` attribute is set to `time`.

attributes.name: decimal-places
attributes.description:
Round the value when formatted as a percentage to the given number of decimal places. Only
available if `format` attribute is `percent`.

tags.name: media-slider-video
tags.description:
Used to load a low-resolution video to be displayed when the user is hovering over or dragging
the time slider. The preview video will automatically be updated to be in-sync with the current
preview position, so ensure it has the same length as the original media (i.e., same duration).

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: The URL of a media resource to use.

tags.name: media-slider
tags.description:
A custom-built range input that is cross-browser friendly, ARIA friendly, mouse/touch-friendly
and easily style-able. The slider allows users to input numeric values between a minimum and
maximum value.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The lowest slider value in the range of permitted values.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The greatest slider value in the range of permitted values.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the slider should be disabled (non-interactive).

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The current slider value.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description:
A number that specifies the granularity that the slider value must adhere to.

A step is an abstract unit that may carry a different type of measure depending on the type of
slider. For example, for the volume slider each step is 1% of volume, and for the time slider
it is 1 second which is a varying percentage depending on the media duration.

attributes.name: key-step
attributes.description:
♿ **ARIA:** A number that specifies the number of steps taken when interacting with
the slider via keyboard.

A step is an abstract unit that may carry different type of measure depending on the type of
slider. For example, for the volume slider each step is 1% of volume, and for the time slider
it is 1 second which is a varying percentage depending on the media duration.

attributes.name: shift-key-multiplier
attributes.description:
♿ **ARIA:** A number that will be used to multiply the `keyStep` when the `Shift` key
is held down and the slider value is changed by pressing `LeftArrow` or `RightArrow`. Think
of it as `keyStep * shiftKeyMultiplier`.

tags.name: media-time-slider
tags.description: A slider control that lets the user specify their desired time level.

attributes.name: pause-while-dragging
attributes.description:
Whether it should request playback to pause while the user is dragging the
thumb. If the media was playing before the dragging starts, the state will be restored by
dispatching a user play request once the dragging ends.

attributes.name: seeking-request-throttle
attributes.description: The amount of milliseconds to throttle media seeking request events being dispatched.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the slider should be disabled (non-interactive).

attributes.name: step
attributes.description:
A number that specifies the granularity that the slider value must adhere to.

A step is an abstract unit that may carry a different type of measure depending on the type of
slider. For example, for the volume slider each step is 1% of volume, and for the time slider
it is 1 second which is a varying percentage depending on the media duration.

attributes.name: key-step
attributes.description:
♿ **ARIA:** A number that specifies the number of steps taken when interacting with
the slider via keyboard.

A step is an abstract unit that may carry different type of measure depending on the type of
slider. For example, for the volume slider each step is 1% of volume, and for the time slider
it is 1 second which is a varying percentage depending on the media duration.

attributes.name: shift-key-multiplier
attributes.description:
♿ **ARIA:** A number that will be used to multiply the `keyStep` when the `Shift` key
is held down and the slider value is changed by pressing `LeftArrow` or `RightArrow`. Think
of it as `keyStep * shiftKeyMultiplier`.

tags.name: media-volume-slider
tags.description: A slider control that lets the user specify their desired volume level.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the slider should be disabled (non-interactive).

attributes.name: step
attributes.description:
A number that specifies the granularity that the slider value must adhere to.

A step is an abstract unit that may carry a different type of measure depending on the type of
slider. For example, for the volume slider each step is 1% of volume, and for the time slider
it is 1 second which is a varying percentage depending on the media duration.

attributes.name: key-step
attributes.description:
♿ **ARIA:** A number that specifies the number of steps taken when interacting with
the slider via keyboard.

A step is an abstract unit that may carry different type of measure depending on the type of
slider. For example, for the volume slider each step is 1% of volume, and for the time slider
it is 1 second which is a varying percentage depending on the media duration.

attributes.name: shift-key-multiplier
attributes.description:
♿ **ARIA:** A number that will be used to multiply the `keyStep` when the `Shift` key
is held down and the slider value is changed by pressing `LeftArrow` or `RightArrow`. Think
of it as `keyStep * shiftKeyMultiplier`.

tags.name: media-thumbnail
tags.description: Used to load and display a preview thumbnail at the given `time`.

attributes.name: time
attributes.description: Finds, loads, and displays the first active thumbnail cue that's start/end times are in range.

tags.name: media-time
tags.description:
Outputs a media duration (eg: `currentTime`, `duration`, `bufferedAmount`, etc.) value as time
formatted text.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of media time to track.

attributes.name: show-hours
attributes.description:
Whether the time should always show the hours unit, even if the time is less than
1 hour.

attributes.name: pad-hours
attributes.description: Whether the hours unit should be padded with zeroes to a length of 2.

attributes.name: pad-minutes
attributes.description: Whether the minutes unit should be padded with zeroes to a length of 2.

attributes.name: remainder
attributes.description: Whether to display the remaining time from the current type, until the duration is reached.

tags.name: media-tooltip
tags.description:
A contextual text bubble that displays a description for an element that appears on pointer
hover or keyboard focus.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: Specifies the position at which the tooltip is placed.
